prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "UserID": ["User1", "User2", "User3", "User4", "User5", "User6"],
    "SessionDurationMinutes": [15, 25, 10, 30, 22, 18],
    "PagesViewed": [5, 8, 3, 10, 7, 6],
    "DeviceType": ["Desktop", "Mobile", "Desktop", "Mobile", "Desktop", "Mobile"],
    "Converted": [True, False, False, True, True, False]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Calculate the conversion rate (percentage of users who "Converted") for users on "Desktop". 2) Calculate the conversion rate for users on "Mobile". 3) Print both conversion rates, clearly labeling which rate corresponds to which "DeviceType". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame and accurately calculate and print the conversion rates for Desktop and Mobile users separately.
